item.title: Rational gaps between reals
item.description: There always exists a rational number between any two real numbers. To prove this fact it is useful to think about what this means in mathematical terms exctly. Let’s consider a rational number \( q \in \mathbb{Q} \), the set of rational numbers, and two different real numbers $ x $ and $ y $.
